title: Dal Makhani | Restaurant style | Side Dish
content:
Side Dish: Dal Makhani  Servings: 2 kadai  Duration: 30 mins Dal Makhani is a popular dish from Punjab, India 🇮🇳. It is combination of whole black lentils, red kidney beans, ghee and more which we call them black urad dal and Rajma. It is rich in taste, texture and protein as well and if you have gone through my yesterday's recipe it also made out of urad dal but used skinless urad. Lentils are high protein, high fiber from legume family and Whole black lentils has more Nutrition values check here Coming to red kidney beans, they are super delicious in taste, rich in folate, iron and vitamin k for more info check here So totally this dish contains loads of iron, protein , fiber and delicious as well 😋. Today I prepared this super recipe Dal Makhani with spices and cream. It's a side dish goes well with roti, Naan, Butter Naan, garlic butter Naan, kulcha, rice links shared below ( procedure section) I hope you like it 🙂 Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Whole Black lentils - 100 gms
  • Red kidney beans/ Rajma - 1/4 cup - 60 gms
  • Ghee/ clarified butter - 1 1/2 tb sp
  • Ginger-garlic paste - 1/2 tb sp
  • Green chillies - 2 - chopped
  • Onion - medium- 2 - finely chopped
  • Tomatoes - 3 - medium sized- finely chopped
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Red chilly powder - 1 tsp
  • Cumin powder- 1 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 2 tsp
  • Garam Masala powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Fresh cream - 1/4 cup - 60 ml
  • Coriander leaves / cilantro - 1 cup - finely chopped
Toppings:
  • Fresh cream - 1/4 cup - 60 ml
  • Coriander leaves / cilantro - handful  - finely chopped
Fried ghee & chilly powder:
  • Ghee - 1/2 tb sp
  • Red chilly powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Heat tempering pan over medium heat, add ghee & red chilly powder . Fry 30 secs and turn off heat
Procedure: Pre-preparation:
  • Wash twice & Add black gram and Rajma in a mixing bowl
  • Add sufficient water and soak 8 hours
  • Strain water and add in pressure cooker
  • Add 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder & 300 ml water
  • Cook for about 3 whistles over medium heat
  • Turnoff heat & let pressure goes off
  • Takeout cooked beans and dal in a bowl
Process of Dal Makhani:
  • Heat a deep frying pan over medium heat
  • Add ghee, Let it melt
  • Add green chillies and onion, Saute 2 mins
  • Add ginger-garlic paste & Saute 30 secs
  • Next add finely chopped tomatoes, mix well
  • Saute 5 mins and add salt, red chilly powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, Garam Masala Powder & turmeric powder
  • Mix well and saute one min
  • Next add cooked Dal & red kidney beans, mix well
  • Add 1 cup of water (160 ml) and cilantro, stir
  • Cover with lid and simmer 20 mins (let it cook)
  • After 20 mins open lid and adjust consistency by adding water ( if required)
  • For me, it's cooked well and consistency is good and I'm finishing it with toppings
  • Add fresh cream , cilantro and fried ghee & red chilly powder
  • Gently mix and serve in Kadai with Garlic Butter Naan, Butter Naan,Chapathi,Jeera Rice 🍚 
  • Happy cooking 👩🏻‍🍳 & Enjoy your day 🙂
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Instead of ghee you can also add butter but traditionally it prepared with only freshly homemade ghee
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • If you don't have fresh cream at home you can replace it Cashew nuts paste ( soak cashew nuts in water for about 15 mins and blend into smooth paste)
